revised_title: Observations of the Transit of Venus and the Eclipse of the Sun in 1769
tldr: The author, Francis Wollaston, observes the transit of Venus and the subsequent solar eclipse in 1769 using a Short's reflector telescope. He provides detailed observations of the event, including the time of first contact, phases of the eclipse, and the behavior of sunspots. Wollaston also describes his telescope and its unique design, which allows for better stability and accuracy in observations.
